tags: remember why we love bran in the first place
title: Bran- Cuteness overload
body:
“He is a sweet boy, quick to laugh, easy to love.”

Who can resist this sweetie?

When he begged for puppies’ life.

When he thought life was an adventure.

Gif: fuckyeahhousestark

When he was caught lying by Mommy.

When he smiled goodbye to Daddy.

Gif: gotsources 

When he smiled hello to “the Imp”.

Gif: themaesters

When he bursted into laughters seeing the saddle Tyrion designed for him.

Source: weheartit

When he was shouting and screaming excitedly on the horseback as if the dream to become a knight could be real again. 

Gif: starkhousesource

A fractious student…

Gif: menofgot

… always gave his teacher a headache…

Source: Giphy

… too smart for his own good…

Gif: branstarksource

… but not too hard to entertain. 

He was full of hope right the moment Maester Luwin told him Dothraki boys learned to ride from 4 years old, and with Tyrion’s saddle, he could ride too.

Being protective of his big brother, but mature enough to understand that his responsibility is to listen to his people, even to those he does not personally like.

Gif:  arin-arryn

Many grown-up lords have to learn this wisdom from this 10-year-old lordling.

When he bravely looked at his surrogate brother in the eye. 

He didn’t blame Theon for betrayal, he just asked a Theon a question that forced him to think, and to feel, as a human who still has a heart.

Source: chesterbennington

When he turned to give his burnt home one last look and reminded himself to live on. 

Gif: lady-meera-reed (This gif is compiled from different scenes, still we’ve got the feel.)

When he tried to stay strong and be protective to his little brother. 

Gif: iheartgot

Gif: branstarksource

D&D, give us back smiling Bran. This boy deserves all the happiness in the world. He deserves it. We audience deserve it.

“It’s not like he’s not Bran anymore. It’s just the part of his head that is Bran is a much, much smaller part of his personality now. When he is with the Starks and his family, that part of him flares up. But really, he’s transcended that – he kind of exists beyond human beings and human issues and problems. He is time”. (Isaac Hempstead Wright on Bran Stark in season 8)

“We see a slightly wiser Bran this year, who’s less like robot overload.” (Isaac Hempstead-Wright on Bran in S8, EW)

“His greatest desire is to become a knight.” (Isaac Hempstead-Wright on Bran’s history)

summary: What do you think of Bran Stark? (As a person and character, because most analyses that I've read of him only examines his...
question: What do you think of Bran Stark? (As a person and character, because most analyses that I've read of him only examines his magical abilities and future plot roles, never about his personality).
answer:
Of all the young PoVs, Bran’s the one who feels most like a kid to me, the most unformed in terms of personality and uncertain of his future. Part of that uncertainty is because a big chunk of his story involves coming to terms with his disability. He wants to be a knight, he wants to walk and run and play like the other kids do. Magic is magic, but magic is also very lonely, and Bran clearly likes having friends. He’s one of the more extroverted Starks, from what I can see.

For the most part, I like Bran. Most of the time, he’s a sweet, thoughtful kid, who’s seen thinking some pretty deep thoughts with some regularity:

He looked up. Wrapped in his furs and leathers, mounted on his great warhorse, his lord father loomed over him like a giant. “Robb says the man died bravely, but Jon says he was afraid.”

“What do you think?“ his father asked.

Bran thought about it. “Can a man still be brave if he’s afraid?”

- Bran I, AGoT

Bran could perch for hours among the shapeless, rain-worn gargoyles that brooded over the First Keep, watching it all: the men drilling with wood and steel in the yard, the cooks tending their vegetables in the glass garden, restless dogs running back and forth in the kennels, the silence of the godswood, the girls gossiping beside the washing well. It made him feel like he was lord of the castle, in a way even Robb would never know.

- Bran II, AGoT

“Then let Lord Hornwood’s bastard be the heir,” Bran said, thinking of his half brother Jon.

- Bran II, ACoK

Bran gets the fundamental truths of people.

But, like every character in this series, there are times when Bran shows a meaner streak. In particular, he was never willing to give the Walders a chance socially even before we saw that they’re little jerks at best and very worrying at worst, and his treatment of Hodor sometimes shows a disregard of Hodor’s very humanity that I expect Bran will have to face up to internally at some point.

Of all the young PoVs, Bran’s the one who feels most like a kid to me, the most unformed in terms of personality and uncertain of his future. Part of that uncertainty is because a big chunk of his story involves coming to terms with his disability. He wants to be a knight, he wants to walk and run and play like the other kids do. Magic is magic, but magic is also very lonely, and Bran clearly likes having friends. He’s one of the more extroverted Starks, from what I can see.

For the most part, I like Bran. Most of the time, he’s a sweet, thoughtful kid, who’s seen thinking some pretty deep thoughts with some regularity:

He looked up. Wrapped in his furs and leathers, mounted on his great warhorse, his lord father loomed over him like a giant. “Robb says the man died bravely, but Jon says he was afraid.”

“What do you think?“ his father asked.

Of all the young PoVs, Bran’s the one who feels most like a kid to me, the most unformed in terms of personality and uncertain of his future. Part of that uncertainty is because a big chunk of his story involves coming to terms with his disability. He wants to be a knight, he wants to walk and run and play like the other kids do. Magic is magic, but magic is also very lonely, and Bran clearly likes having friends. He’s one of the more extroverted Starks, from what I can see.

He looked up. Wrapped in his furs and leathers, mounted on his great warhorse, his lord father loomed over him like a giant. “Robb says the man died bravely, but Jon says he was afraid.”

In particular, he was never willing to give the Walders a chance socially even before we saw that they’re little jerks at best and very worrying at worst, and his treatment of Hodor sometimes shows a disregard of Hodor’s very humanity that I expect Bran will have to face up to internally at some point.

summary: I know you don’t like Dany or Jon and even though they’re my favs I’m curious about your opinion and I’m not coming here as hate...
question: I know you don’t like Dany or Jon and even though they’re my favs I’m curious about your opinion and I’m not coming here as hate or anything just curious. I know lots of Sansa stans want her to rule and Dany and Jon to leave let’s say this happened that she gets QITN and D&J leave it to her and they take the dragons and all of Danys army with them. Who defeats the NK and WW? That’s like the one thing I don’t get about people being mad about Jon bringing Dany to Winterfell.
answer:
Bran. 

Anyway no one is angry he brought her, they’re angry he knelt to her. He threw away the North’s independence to a character who just recently burnt an entire army alive and destroyed food because she was angry.

blog.name: madaboutasoiaf
blog.title: Fear cuts deeper than swords
blog.description: Jo, Female, Australian, This is an ASOIAF blog. Not a spoiler free zone

summary:
castleintheskye
 replied to your post  “I feel like writing an Arya ficlet or two to counteract the current...”
                ...
body:
castleintheskye replied to your post “I feel like writing an Arya ficlet or two to counteract the current…”

Snow + Winterfell (preferably childhood)

Arya loves snow. She runs through the godswood, breathing in the smells of snow and smoke and pine needles. The guests in Winterfell are complaining about the snow, about the cold.

“That’s stupid,” she tells Jon. “It is summer.”

Old Nan tells Arya she is a summer child, that the winter snows bring death but Old Nan also says that fear is for the winter, and Arya won’t fear snow until winter comes, and she’s not sure she’ll fear it even then.

Snow means snowballs. It means Sansa squealing and Bran laughing and Arya chasing her younger brothers, a melting snowball in her hand. Bran climbs a tree to get high, out of her reach but that doesn’t stop Arya. She just climbs up after him, the snow from the branches falling as she climbs, her discarded snowball melting, forgotten on the ground below her.

“The septa will see you,” Bran warns her.

“Not if I climb to the top,” Arya throws back at him.

Bran smiles when she joins him and it’s enough that she decides to just muss his hair with her wet hands.

“Stop it, Arya,” he whines, still smiling.

They sit together in the branches, watching Rickon looking up at them longingly, still too small to join them yet. The snow begins to fall once more, soft flakes that land on Arya’s cheeks, and melt in Bran’s fiery red hair.

Snow is Winterfell, she thinks. Snow is home.

summary: What did you think about Bran in season 6?
question: What did you think about Bran in season 6?
answer:
Some bits were good! I liked what we saw of Bran’s boredom and frustration with the grind of learning magic stuff. I really liked when he asked if he could stay in the vision of Winterfell and watch the past version of his father for just a bit longer.

Structurally, however, Bran’s barely got his own plot. His season six material was thoroughly dominated by the setpiece of Hodor’s death (which I did not enjoy in the slightest) and the R+L=J material (which was extremely out of place, every bit as wheel-spinny as a lot of the rest of season six, misunderstood Ned to a significant degree, and didn’t even manage to clearly imply that no, no, R plus L equals J).

What I think about Bran in season six, basically, is that the story could have used more Bran.

blog.description: "all the elements in your body were forged many, many millions of years ago in the heart of a far away star that explosed and died. that explosion scattered those elements across the desolations of deep space, until, eventually, they came together to make you. you are unique in the universe." - doctor who. marie; taurus, istj. blarke is my core, olicity trash, bitter queen. love girls on tv, pro-girls unity. atla/tlok hoe. waiting for the doctor. samwise gamgee saved middle earth. daensa is endgame, & sansa and dany are both queens ; protect the dragons (and the direwolves). sam winchester and jack kline are the softest. korra is bae. thor is the strongest avenger. mcu/dc(tv), lotr, got, spn. [ship and let ship]
